results.title: The Living laboratory
results.creator_credit: Department of Information, Government of South Africa and Raymond Hancock
results.brief_description: A survey of South Africa’s varied scientific progress. It is an area which has stimulated pioneering scientists in the widening fields of archaeology and anthropology. A vast spectrum of ancient and modern life and living patterns provides sociologists, ecologists, veterinary and medical scientists with research material.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Department of Information, Government of South Africa and Raymond Hancock

results.title: The Living goddess
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Cinetel Productions, Frank Heimans and Josette Heimans
results.brief_description: Kumari, a virgin girl-child is installed as a deity in Nepal, and wields more power among her people than almost any other living person. Shows ceremonial and religious pageant of her accession in Nepal. Written and narrated by Paul Ricketts.

results.title: The Living gallery
results.brief_description: Recreation for children and adults is a problem for every community. The Art Gallery of Toronto provides many activities in addition to the usual tours and conducted parties. For children there are classes in art, hobby work, story-telling and other creative projects. Art becomes more than gazing at pictures.

results.title: The Living Forest (Captioned)
results.brief_description: As populations expand so do the demands being made on forests to provide living space and forest products. If the forest is to continue to supply our needs, what are the appropriate measures required to conserve it? This program is a detailed study of the ecology of a eucalypt forest and the many plants and animals which make up the forest community.

results.title: The Living forest
results.creator_credit: Victorian Forests Commission, Ken J. Widdowson and Tom Morrison
results.brief_description: A film which shows how man is making heavy demands on the earth’s remaining forests. A detailed study is made of the ecology of a eucalypt forest and the many plants and animals which make up the forest environment.

results.title: The Living filter
results.creator_credit: Hornbein-Wood Films and Pennsylvania State University
results.brief_description: Describes an experiment in which municipal waste water was used to irrigate forest and farmland, thereby increasing plant growth and purifying the water to drinking quality. The experiment also suggests the potential use of the technique in reclaiming strip-mined land.

results.title: The Living city
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Twentieth Century Fund and John Barnes
results.brief_description: Surveys the need for redevelopment of American cities and the forces which have created problems in urban areas; describes obstacles which deter the elimination of blighted areas and tenements and the relief of traffic congestion. Includes scenes of St Louis in 1890, and of present-day housing and building programs in Baltimore, Philadelphia and Pittsburgh.

results.title: The Living cell: an introduction
results.brief_description: Introduces the fundamental principles of cell biology, examining structures and biochemical processes that occur in all living cells. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: The Living camera, with Paul
results.creator_credit: Time-Life Broadcast, Drew Associates, Robert Drew, Greg Shuker, R. Leacock and D.A. Pennebaker
results.brief_description: Can a murderer become rehabilitated while he sits in death row for nine years awaiting electrocution? If he can, should his sentence be commuted to life? A young Chicago attorney answers “yes” to both questions. He then undergoes the agony and elation of a successful plea to the parole board with famed Louis Nizer at his side. Filmed with hand-held camera and sound recorder.
